{{Infobox person | image = | name = Sarah Joy Brown | birth_name = Sarah Joy Brown | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1975|02|18}} | birth_place = [[Eureka, California]], [[United States|U.S.]] | occupation = [[Film]], [[television]] [[actress]] | spouse = | yearsactive = 1994-present | domesticpartner = [[Shuki Levy]] 1 daughter (b. 1998) | website = http://www.sarahbrown.net }} '''Sarah Joy Brown''' (born February 18, 1975)http://www.filmbug.com/db/21444 is an [[United States|American]] [[actress]]. She is perhaps best known for originating the role of [[Carly Corinthos]], which she portrayed on the American daytime drama ''[[General Hospital]]'' from 1996 to 2001, and which earned her three [[Daytime Emmy Awards]]. In 2008, she returned to ''General Hospital'' in a different role, [[Claudia Zacchara]]. She exited ''General Hospital'' once again in 2009 and began appearing on ''[[The Bold and the Beautiful]]'' in the newly created role of [[Aggie Jones]].{{cite news |title=General Hospital' star checking into another soap |author= |newspaper=Associated Press |date=September 30, 2009 |url=http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20090930/ap_en_tv/us_tv_bold_and_beautiful_brown }} ==Life and career== Brown was born in [[Eureka, California]], to David and Pamela Brown. She attended the Los Angeles County High School for Performing Arts. Her acting career began at the age of 19, when she was cast as Kaitlin Star on the syndicated children's show, ''[[VR Troopers]]''. In 1996, she made a guest appearance in a 3-part episode of ''[[Power Rangers: Zeo]]'' playing Heather, a girl that sparks interest in [[Tommy Oliver]] (played by [[Jason David Frank]]). An article in FOX Kids Magazine claimed a member of the VR Troopers cast would be quitting the series to become a part of the Power Rangers cast, however the aforementioned Zeo three-parter is the closest anything like this ever came to happening. In April 1996 Brown originated the role of [[Carly Corinthos]] on the [[United States|American]] [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]] [[soap opera]] ''[[General Hospital]]''.{{cite web|url=http://www.soaps.com/generalhospital/cast/325/Carly_Corinthos_Jacks|title=''General Hospital'' Cast: Carly Corinthos Jacks|publisher=Soaps.com|accessdate=January 30, 2009}} Brown "quickly became an overnight sensation" and received three [[Daytime Emmy Award]]s for her portrayal of Carly.{{cite web|url=http://www.soapoperadigest.com/features/as-the-world-turns/interviews/sarahbrown/ |title=''As the World Turns'' Interview: Who Is Sarah Brown? |last=Lenhart |first=Jennifer |publisher=SoapOperaDigest.com |accessdate=January 30, 2009}} She won for [[Daytime Emmy Award for Outstanding Younger Actress in a Drama Series|Outstanding Younger Actress]] in 1997{{cite web|url=http://www.soapoperadigest.com/Emmys/winners1997/index.html|title=Daytime Emmy Winners & Nominees: 1997|publisher=SoapOperaDigest.com|accessdate=January 30, 2009}} and 1998,{{cite web|url=http://www.soapoperadigest.com/Emmys/winners1998/index.html|title=Daytime Emmy Winners & Nominees: 1998|publisher=SoapOperaDigest.com|accessdate=January 30, 2009}} was nominated in 1999,{{cite web|url=http://www.soapoperadigest.com/Emmys/winners1999/index.html|title=Daytime Emmy Winners & Nominees: 1999|publisher=SoapOperaDigest.com|accessdate=January 30, 2009}} and won again for [[Daytime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Drama Series|Outstanding Supporting Actress]] in 2000.{{cite web|url=http://www.soapoperadigest.com/Emmys/winners2000/index.html|title=Daytime Emmy Winners & Nominees: 2000|publisher=SoapOperaDigest.com|accessdate=January 13, 2009}} In 2010, she received her first Daytime Emmy nomination in the Lead Actress category for her work as Claudia Zacchara. Brown appeared on the cover of ''[[Soap Opera Digest]]'' 19 times during her run in the role, and won two ''Soap Opera Digest'' Awards in 1998 (Younger Lead Actress){{cite web|url=http://www.soapoperadigest.com/awards/1998/index.html|title=The ''Soap Opera Digest'' Awards: 1998|publisher=SoapOperaDigest.com|accessdate=January 30, 2009}} and 2000 (Favorite Actress).{{cite web|url=http://www.soapoperadigest.com/awards/2000/index.html|title=The ''Soap Opera Digest'' Awards: 2000|publisher=SoapOperaDigest.com|accessdate=January 30, 2009}} She departed the series in April 2001. After leaving ''General Hospital'', Brown guest-starred on many hit television series, including ''[[Crossing Jordan]]'', ''[[Strong Medicine]]'' and ''[[Without a Trace]]''. She returned to daytime in the role of [[Julia Morrisey Larrabee]] on ''[[As the World Turns]]'' from August 2004 to March 2005, in which she appeared in 109 episodes. In 2004, Brown played the lead role of Kate Vignatti in the fact-based television movie [[The Perfect Husband: The Laci Peterson Story]]. She became a regular on the popular [[CBS]] crime drama ''[[Cold Case (TV series)|Cold Case]]'' in the fall of 2005 but was let go after only a few months (she appeared in five episodes) with the series. In 2006, she starred in her first feature film, the comedy, ''[[Big Momma's House 2]]'' and appeared in an episode of ''[[Monk (TV series)|Monk]]'' the same year. Brown was most recently seen in the second season finale of ''[[The Closer]]'' and on a 2007 episode of the [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]] [[police drama]] ''[[K-Ville (TV series)|K-Ville]]''. Brown is a practicing convert to [[Judaism]].{{cite web | last =| first =| authorlink =| coauthors =| title=Q & A with Sarah Brown (Carly Roberts, General Hospital)| publisher =Soap Opera Article 17| date =| url =http://members.shaw.ca/almosthuman73/soaparticle17.html| accessdate =2006-12-13 }} She has one daughter, Jordan Alexandra Judith (b. July 20, 1998); the father is Brown's ex-fiancÃ©, [[Israel]] composer [[Shuki Levy]] (a former executive producer on ''VR Troopers'' and the ''Power Rangers'' franchise). Brown has been diagnosed with [[Celiac Disease]].{{cite web |url=http://www.justmommies.com/articles/sarah-brown.shtml |title=Soap Star Sarah Brown on Family |publisher=www.justmommies.com |accessdate=2009-12-11 }} Brown returned to ''General Hospital'' on January 31, 2008 in the role of [[Claudia Zacchara]]. Brown announced on her [[Twitter]] September 16, 2009 that she would be leaving [[General Hospital]] in mid October 2009.{{Citation needed|date=December 2009}} Brown has also announced on her [[Twitter]] account that she would be making an appearance on the ABC's [[Castle (TV series)]] In July 2011, numerous soap outlets confirmed that Brown would join the cast of [[Days of our Lives]] as Madison James, a successful business woman.
